newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkey signs $543 mln helicopter deals.
newsitem.headline: Turkey signs $543 mln helicopter deals.

text.p: Turkey on Thursday signed two deals worth a total of $543 million to produce helicopters with French-German group Eurocopter and buy U.S.-made Sikorsky helicopters.

"With the signing of these contracts with Eurocopter and Sikorsky our armed forces will have taken a concrete step towards modernisation for the future," Yalcin Burcak, Turkey's defence under-secretary, said at a ceremony before initialling the agreements.

Defence officials said Turkey would make 30 Cougar helicopters, mostly search-and-rescue aircraft, in a $430 million joint venture with Eurocopter, owned by French state-run Aerospatiale and Germany's Daimler-Benz Aerospace.
Turkish companies will take a 30 percent stake in the venture, which is to provide the first helicopters by July, 1999.
The Turkish navy will also buy four Sikorsky Sea Hawk helicopters for its navy for $113 million to be delivered in under three years, the officials said.
NATO-member Turkey, a major arms buyer, makes extensive use of helicopters in its fight against Kurdish guerrillas in the mountainous southeast.
